# General project's topic and documentation
- This is a web application project.
- The project feature specifications and requirements are documented in the `docs/` directory.
- Read the documents in the `docs/` directory for detailed information about the project's features and requirements every time you work on a new feature or bug fix.

# Coding standards and best practices
- Do not generate or add redundant comments in the code.
- Do not generate redundant scripts or files that used for testing and bug fixing. Make changes directly to the main codebase, i will review and merge them.
- Test by running the application through a web browser or API client to ensure all features work as expected.
- Include detailed comments explaining the content of each files at the beginning of the file.
- Keep line comments short and to the point, focusing on explaining complex logic or important sections of the code.

# General
- If multiple options are available for implementing a feature or fixing a bug, ask the user for their preference before proceeding.
- Always ensure that the code adheres to best practices for security, performance, and maintainability
- If you encounter any ambiguities or uncertainties in the requirements or specifications, ask for clarification before proceeding with the implementation.
- Ensure that all code changes are well-documented, including explanations of the purpose and functionality of new functions, classes, or modules.
- Keep a log of all changes made to the codebase, including bug fixes, feature additions, and refactoring efforts. (CHANGELOG.md in the 'docs/')
